page.title: 06Honeycombe Farm
page.content: {Mr.Brian Ashmead}has farmed at Honeycombe for 32 years.He has a herd of Friesians,a Hereford bull and some chickens.The different crops grown are silage,grazing grass,winter barley and rye grass. Honeycombe Farm covers{246 acres}and the Miserden Estate rents 6 acres.It is thought that the land has been farmed since before the original Domesday Book. {Badgers}are considered a pest and on one occasion a dying badger was thought to have spread tuberculosis to the stock.This resulted in a number of cows being slaughtered. Part of the farm is on Greater Oolite rock,part on Lesser Oolite.A band of Fuller's Earth runs between. This can mean a constantly changing field surface.
